drawing_instructions.thinking: I see an empty canvas, and feeling sad, I want to start by drawing a weeping willow tree - its drooping branches perfectly capture melancholy. I'll use the wiggle brush to create long, flowing downward lines in a dark blue shade to represent the hanging branches, starting from a central point near the top of the canvas. This will symbolize tears and the weight of sadness pulling everything downward.

Looking at the weeping willow branches drooping down, I want to enhance the feeling of sadness by adding raindrops falling from the sky. I'll use the marker brush with a light blue color to create teardrops falling around the willow branches. The scattered drops will emphasize the melancholy mood, like nature crying along with the willow tree. I'll place them in a pattern that follows the flow of the branches.

I notice the weeping willow and falling teardrops that create a melancholic scene. To amplify the sad mood, I want to add a soft, misty cloud behind the willow using light blue tones. This represents the heavy weight of sadness hanging in the air. The cloud will be placed centrally, using gentle marker strokes to create a diffused, foggy effect that enhances the gloomy atmosphere.

Looking at the melancholic scene with the weeping willow, teardrops, and misty cloud, I want to add more weight to the sadness by drawing some falling leaves being carried down by the rain. I'll use the wiggle brush with a darker blue tone to create these small, swirling leaves caught in their descent. The curved, meandering paths of the leaves will emphasize the feeling of being lost and carried away by sorrow.

Looking at the melancholic weeping willow scene, I want to add more branches with a gentle, drooping motion to enhance the feeling of despair and heaviness. I'll use the wiggle brush to create additional curved, flowing lines that cascade downward from the central point, making the willow appear even more weighted with sorrow. The lines will interweave with the existing branches, creating a more dense curtain of 'tears' falling from the tree.

Looking at this deeply melancholic scene, I want to add some gentle, misty rain in the background to enhance the feeling of sadness and isolation. I'll use the spray brush to create a soft, scattered pattern of dots that will look like distant rainfall, adding depth and emphasizing the gloomy atmosphere. I'll focus on the upper right area of the canvas, letting the rain appear to fall diagonally, as if being blown by a sorrowful wind.

Looking at this melancholic scene with the weeping willow and rain, I want to add a small, lonely puddle at the bottom to reflect the tears falling from above. I'll use the marker brush with a light sky blue color to create a gentle, oval-shaped pool of water beneath the willow. This will symbolize how sadness collects and pools, while also giving the scene a sense of quiet reflection.

The scene is heavy with sorrow - the weeping willow, the rain, and the lonely puddle below. To amplify this feeling of melancholy, I want to add some darker clouds gathering above the willow, using the marker brush with a darker shade of blue. These heavy clouds will create a sense of emotional weight pressing down from above, reinforcing the downward motion of the entire piece and the feeling of being overwhelmed by sadness.

Looking at this deeply melancholic scene, I want to add more teardrops falling from the willow branches. These will be small, delicate drops using the wiggle brush in a light sky blue color, creating a gentle cascade that emphasizes the weeping nature of the tree. The teardrops will fall in a subtle curved pattern, expressing how sadness flows continuously downward, each drop representing a moment of sorrow.

Looking at this melancholic scene with its weeping willow and rain, I want to add some gently falling leaves to emphasize the feeling of letting go and loss. I'll use the wiggle brush with a dark Keppel color to create small, delicate leaves slowly drifting down alongside the tears. These leaves will symbolize how pieces of us fall away when we're deeply sad, creating a subtle dance of descent that adds to the overall feeling of melancholy.

Looking at this melancholic scene, I want to add more darkness to the storm cloud using the spray brush. The scattered dots will create a sense of heavy atmosphere and impending rain, spreading from right to left across the top of the canvas. This will enhance the feeling of overwhelming sadness and emotional turbulence hovering above. The spray pattern will be denser on the right side and gradually disperse towards the left, suggesting how sadness can feel like it's closing in on us.

Looking at this melancholic scene, I want to add more depth to the puddle beneath the willow to symbolize the depths of sadness. I'll use the marker brush with a darker shade of Sky Blue to create gentle ripples in the water, suggesting how our tears create ripples in the pool of our sorrows. The curved lines will be subtle and overlapping, centered below the willow, creating a sense of accumulated sadness pooling beneath.

Looking at this deeply emotional scene, I want to add some falling teardrops that will merge with the puddle below. I'll use the wiggle brush with a light Sky Blue color to create delicate, wavy lines suggesting tears falling from the willow's branches. These will be placed between existing elements, adding to the sense of continuous weeping and emotional release. The teardrops will start from around the branches and curve gently as they fall, as if being carried by a soft, melancholic breeze.

Looking at this deeply sorrowful scene with its weeping willow and rain clouds, I want to add more teardrops falling from one of the willow branches. I'll place these on the right side where there's a bit more space, using the wiggle brush with a light Sky Blue to create delicate, wavy lines that represent tears. This will enhance the feeling of continuous weeping and emotional release. The teardrops will fall in a gentle curve, symbolizing how sadness flows naturally downward.

Looking at this deeply melancholic scene, I feel the need to add another dark cloud element at the bottom to create a sense of being surrounded by sadness. I'll use the marker brush with a dark Sky Blue color (#1B5C72) to draw a long, heavy cloud form that mirrors the one at the top. This will create a feeling of being enveloped by sorrow, with the willow and its tears caught between these heavy masses of emotion. The lower cloud will curve gently, suggesting the weight of accumulated sadness.
